name: deterministically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is planned or decided: We can decide to sample deterministically instead of choosing random samples. Participants were linked deterministically to one of the databases using their health card number.
in a way that relates to the belief that everything that happens must happen as it does and could not have happened in any other way: This contrasts with the view that life is an inevitable, deterministically directed series of events.
More examplesFewer examplesAnother way things can happen deterministically without consent is by the use of coercion.He argues that new dialects emerge deterministically from the demographic mix of language varieties.
